#summary access control rules for the data collections in Chassis Manta

= Introduction =

This page describes the access control rules for the data collections in the Chassis Manta product.

Example ACLs are given using the [http://atombeat.org AtomBeat ACL format].

== The /studies Collection ==

Contributors can list the collection and create members.

Personal data reviewers can list the collection and can retrieve any member.

Curators can list the collection, and can retrieve and update any member.

E.g., ACL for /studies collection ...

{{{
<acl>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CONTRIBUTOR</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CONTRIBUTOR</role>
			<operation>create-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>update-member</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Members of the /studies Collection ==

By convention, each study is associated with a group of users called "administrators".

A study administrator can retrieve and update the study, and can update the study's permissions.

E.g., ACL for member /studies/ABCDE.atom ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators">
			<user>suki@example.org</user>
		</group>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>update-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>update-acl</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Submitted Media Collections, e.g., /media/ABCDE/submitted ==

Each study is linked to a submitted media collection. E.g., the study at /studies/ABCDE.atom is linked to its submitted media collection at /media/ABCDE/submitted.

Personal data reviewers can retrieve any member or media resource.

Other permissions on a submitted media collection are defined with reference to the associated study's administrators group.

The study's administrators can create media resources in the study's submitted media collection, and can list the collection and retrieve and update members (but cannot update media ever, and cannot retrieve media until allowed by personal data reviewer, see below).

E.g., default ACL for /media/ABCDE/submitted collection ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>create-media</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>update-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>retrieve-media</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Media Resources in a Submitted Media Collection ==

Personal data reviewers can update ACLs for media resources (to unlock a media resource which has passed personal data review).

Curators will be allowed to retrieve a media resource if passed by a personal data reviewer.

Other permissions for media resources a submitted media collection are defined with reference to the associated study's administrators group.

Study administrators will be allowed to retrieve a media resource if passed by a personal data reviewer.

E.g., default ACL for media resource /media/ABCDE/submitted/XYZ.media (before personal data review) ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>update-acl</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

E.g., ACL for media resource /media/ABCDE/submitted/XYZ.media after passed by personal data reviewer ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>update-acl</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-media</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-media</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

I.e., when a personal data reviewer passes a submitted media resource, they must also update the ACL for that media resource to allow curators the study's administrators and the study's administrators to retrieve the media resource.

== The /reviews/personal-data Collection ==

Personal data reviewers can list the collection and retrieve any member. Only personal data reviewers can create members.

Curators can list the collection and retrieve any member.

E.g., ACL for the /reviews/personal-data collection ...

{{{
<acl>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>create-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_PERSONAL_DATA_REVIEWER</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Members of the /reviews/personal-data Collection ==

A study administrator can retrieve a review if the review is of a submitted media resource from that study.

E.g., default ACL for member /reviews/personal-data/WWW.atom which reviews a submitted media resource from the study at /studies/ABCDE.atom ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Curated Media Collections, e.g., /media/ABCDE/curated ==

Each study is linked to a curated media collection. E.g., the study at /studies/ABCDE.atom is linked to its curated media collection at /media/ABCDE/curated.

Curators can create media resources, list the collection, retrieve media resources, and retrieve and update members.

Other permissions on a curated media collection are defined with reference to the associated study's administrators group.

The study administrators can list the collection and retrieve members and media resources.

E.g., default ACL for the curated media collection at /media/ABCDE/curated ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>create-media</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>update-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-media</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-media</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}

== Members of Curated Media Collections ==

Members of a curated media collection need no specific ACL rules, all permissions are covered by the collection ACL.

== Derivations Collections, e.g., /derivations/ABCDE ==

Each study is linked to a derivations collection. E.g., the study at /studies/ABCDE.atom is linked to its derivations collection at /derivations/ABCDE.

Curators can create members, list the collection, and retrieve members.

Other permissions on a curated media collection are defined with reference to the associated study's administrators group.

The study administrators can list the collection and retrieve members.

E.g., default ACL for the derivations collection at /derivations/ABCDE ...

{{{
<acl>
	<groups>
		<group name="administrators" src="/studies/ABCDE.atom"/>
	</groups>
	<rules>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>create-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<role>ROLE_CHASSIS_CURATOR</role>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>list-collection</operation>
		</allow>
		<allow>
			<group>administrators</group>
			<operation>retrieve-member</operation>
		</allow>
	</rules>
</acl>
}}}
